de.tschebbischeff.math

Class Vector3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.math.Vector3d

  • public class Vector3d
extends java.lang.Object
    Vector implementation with double precision.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector3d

        public Vector3d(double x,
                double y,
                double z)
        Creates a new vector from the supplied coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the new vector.
        y - The y coordinate of the new vector.
        z - The z coordinate of the new vector.

      • Vector3d

        public Vector3d(double[] v)
        Creates a new vector from the data in the array. The array must contain exactly 3 elements. The first element corresponds to the x-coordinate of the vector, while the second and third elements corresponds to the y- and z-coordinate respectively.
        Parameters:
        v - A three element array containg the data for the new vector.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Gets the x-coordinate of this vector.
        Returns:
        This vector's x-coordinate.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets the y-coordinate of this vector.
        Returns:

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Gets the z-coordinate of this vector.
        Returns:
        This vector's z-coordinate.

      • getData

        public double[] getData()
        Gets the x-, y- and z-coordinate of this vector as an array.
        Returns:
        An array containing this vector's x-coordinate as the first element, and this vector's y- and z-coordinates as the second and third element respectively.

                        double y,
                        double z)
        Sets this vector's x-, y- and z-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-coordinate of this vector.
        y - The new y-coordinate of this vector.
        z - The new z-coordinate of this vector.
        Returns:
        This vector for fluent method calls.

      • setData

        public Vector3d setData(double[] v)
        Sets this vector's x-, y- and z-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        v - A three element array containing the new x-coordinate as the first element and the new y- and z-coordinate as the second and third element respectively.
        Returns:
        This vector for fluent method calls.

      • dot

        public double dot(Vector3d b)
        Produces the dot product of this vector and a second vector.
        Parameters:
        b - The vector to build the dot product with.
        Returns:
        The dot product of this vector and vector b.

      • cross

        public Vector3d cross(Vector3d b)
        Produces the cross product of this vector and a second vector.
        Parameters:
        b - The vector to build the cross product with.
        Returns:
        A new vector which is equal to the cross product of this vector and vector b.

      • len2

        public double len2()
        Calculates the squared length of this vector. This operation skips the calculation of the square root in the length calculation, to allow for better performance when comparing lengths.
        Returns:
        The length of this vector, squared.

      • len

        public double len()
        Calculates the length of this vector. See also len2() for better performance in special cases.
        Returns:
        The length of this vector.

      • normalize

        public Vector3d normalize()
        Normalizes this vector. I.e. this vector is of length 1 afterwards, but still points in the same direction.
        Returns:
        A new vector, which equals this vector normalized.

      • add

        public Vector3d add(Vector3d b)
        Produces the sum of this and another vector.
        Parameters:
        b - The vector to add to this vector.
        Returns:
        A new vector, which is equal to the sum of this vector and vector b.

      • sub

        public Vector3d sub(Vector3d b)
        Produces the difference of this and another vector.
        Parameters:
        b - The vector to subtract from this vector.
        Returns:
        A new vector, which is equal to this vector minus the vector b.

      • scale

        public Vector3d scale(double b)
        Multiplies each of this vector's components with a given scalar.
        Parameters:
        b - The scalar with which each component of this vector is multiplied.
        Returns:
        A new vector, which is equal to this vector scaled by b.

      • angle

        public double angle(Vector3d b)
        Calculates the angle between this vector and another vector.
        Parameters:
        b - The vector with which to calculate the angle.
        Returns:
        The angle between this vector and vector b.

      • anyOrthogonal

        public Vector3d anyOrthogonal()
        Produces a vector, which is definitely orthogonal to this vector. No other assumptions can be made, except that the angle between this vector and the one produced is 90 degrees.
        Returns:
        A vector, which is orthogonal to this vector.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int precision)
        Transforms this vector into a readable format, while rounding to the specified number of digits behind the comma.
        Parameters:
        precision - The number of digits behind the comma.
        Returns:
        A easily readable form of the vector.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Transforms this vector into a readable format, while rounding to three digits behind the comma.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A easily readable form of the vector with three digits behind the comma.
